snippet: With an impulsive punch on Monday night, Amar’e Stoudemire probably ended his season and surely hastened his team’s exit from the playoffs.
abstract: Howard Beck On Pro Basketball column asserts that New York Knicks forward Amar'e Stoudemire hastened his team's exit from the playoffs by punching fire extinguisher case after team's loss to Miami Heat; suggests that outburst was not about a single game but the culmination of disappointment that the team is not better than it is. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Amar'e Stoudemire is not the most loquacious of N.B.A. stars, but he can convey a powerful message with an economy of words and gestures. Two summers ago, he put on a blue ''NYK'' cap and boldly declared, ''The Knicks are back.'' A depressed fan base perked up and dared to believe again. The Knicks were back because he said so.

headline.main: Illusions Shatter With a Left To a Fire Extinguisher Case
